intro: Ichthyomethia americana, commonly known as the American water lily, is a aquatic plant native to North America. It typically grows in shallow freshwater habitats such as ponds and lakes. The plant has broad, floating leaves that are often covered in a waxy cuticle to reduce water loss. Its flowers are showy, with bright yellow petals and a central cluster of stamens. The plant plays an important role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat for various organisms.
